p: Located in Southeast France, in the French Alps, the Écrins National Park (NP) is characterised by strong elevational gradients (from 669 to 4102 m a.s.l.), which together with a diverse flora (ca. 2000 vascular plant species) generate a variety of plant communities, from lowland forests to nival communities, passing through wetlands, as well as schlerophylous vegetation. Around 68% of the park’s surface is currently managed, mainly for agriculture (grazing, 48%; crop fields and mown grasslands, 9.8%) and forestry (14%) [ 24].
